1.rationale:
I'm looking for the apple that's closest and safe. Currently, our snake at (2,4) has an appealing nearby apple at (1,6). Even though it's not immediately adjacent, we're only two or three moves away from it, and the route going upward (and later left) looks safe given our position and that the enemy snake (#2 at (3,8)) is far away from our projected path. 

Moving UP from (2,4) to (2,5) keeps us in the safe zone away from walls and enemy snakes, while progressing toward the near apple. Next turns I’d likely steer left and then up again to eventually collect the apple at (1,6).

Decided move: UP.

Moving up would bring me closer to the apple at (7, 3), but it would also bring me closer to snake #1. However, since snake #1 doesn't have any body parts yet, it's unlikely to pose an immediate threat.

Moving down would take me away from the apples and further from the apples I've already eaten, which is not ideal.

Moving right would bring me closer to the apples at (8, 6) and (6, 3), but it would also bring me closer to the edge of the board.

Given these considerations, I will move right to gather more points and potentially eat the apples at (8, 6) or (6, 3).
